results.title: Tropical Africa
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: An account of the forces that are transforming tribal societies into modern states. The struggle for self government, the effort to establish schools, universities and hospitals as well as the rapidly changing agriculture, industries and communications; relationship between black and white African. Deals with the area south of the Sahara.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William L. Claiborne, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Tropic zone
results.creator_credit: Lewis R. Foster, William Thomas, William H Pine and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A man escaping from a political feud takes refuge in a banana port in Central America where he attempts to save a plantation from being taken over by crooks. Cast includes Ronald Reagan and Rhonda Fleming. Based on the novel “Gentlemen of the jungle” by Tom Gill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lewis R. Foster, William Thomas, William H Pine and Paramount Pictures

results.title: Tropfest 2004
results.creator_credit: Scott Pickett, Abby Hunt, HOST and Sydney Morning Herald
results.brief_description: Tropfest is the world’s largest short film festival, held one night in February each year at the Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney. The aim is to showcase work from young and emerging filmmakers, providing them with a festival atmosphere to screen their works to peers. This disc contains the sixteen 2004 finalists, the Awards Ceremony and Tips for budding filmmakers.

results.title: Tropfest 2003
results.brief_description: Tropfest is the world’s largest short film festival, held one night in February each year at the Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney. The aim is to showcase work from young and emerging filmmakers, providing them with a festival atmosphere to screen their works to peers. In an attempt to encourage production, not just the exhibition of films, the festival has a Tropfest Signature Item, announced a few months prior to the festival. Each film must contain the TSI in whatever form the filmmaker sees fit. In 2003, the TSI was ‘rock’. This disc contains the sixteen 2003 finalists.

results.title: Tropfest 2002 [DVD]
results.brief_description: From humble beginnings the Tropfest film festival first ran in 1993 at the Tropicana Caffe in Sydney’s Darlinghurst. The festival was founded by actor/director John Polson. In it’s tenth year Tropfest has swelled considerably. In 2002 the Intel Tropfest attracted an audience of over 100,000 in Australia (90,000 were at the Sydney screening alone!). The festival attracted a record amount of entries totalling 611 of which 16 finalists were screened. Each year a theme is set for entrants to the festival - this year’s theme was ‘Match’. This video contains the works of the 16 finalists of 2002 and includes the following titles: “Hommes du jour” (dir. Brian Moses); “The Arsonist’s riddle” (dir. Ben West); “Boomerring” (dir. Carla Drago); “Late night shopper” (dir. Tim Bullock); “The Flying nut” (dir. Dean White); “Lamb” (dir. Emma Freeman); “Wilfred” (dir. Tony Rogers); “Murbah swamp beer” (dir. Gary Doust); “The Thing in the roof” (dir. Walter Repich); “FA” (dir. Marie Craven); “Tragic love” (dir. Gary Eck); “Tiny little pieces” (dir. Trent O’Donnell and Phil Lloyd); “Clouds weep on the greenness” (dir. Suda Narayana); “Matchbox” (dir. Julius Avery); “How am I driving” (dir. Tim Dean); “I Can’t get started” (dir. Charles Williams). Website: www.tropfest.com

results.title: Tropfest #9 2001: 16 finalists
results.brief_description: The Sydney Film Festival, Tropfest, is the world’s largest short film festival, held one night in February each year at the Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney. The aim is to showcase work from young and emerging filmmakers, providing them with a festival atmosphere to screen their works to peers. In an attempt to encourage production, not just the exhibition of films, the festival has a Tropfest Signature Item, announced a few months prior to the festival. Each film must contain the TSI in whatever form the filmmaker sees fit. In 2001, the TSI is ‘horn’ and the interpretations leap from, ‘The French’, to something a lot more personal. This tape contains 16 finalists which includes: “A Matter of life” (dir. Jennifer Perrott); “Tickler” (dir. Clayton Jacobson); “Muffled love” (dir. Rene Hernandez); “The Lighter” (dir. Patrick Hughes); “Just not cricket” (dir. Matt Wheeldon); “The Art of farewell” (dir. David Napier); “Beep” (dir. Eddie Edwards); “Like it is” (dirs. Chris Begley, Tony D’Aquino); “Home straight” (dir. Mickey Power); “Chopper” (dir. Bernard Derriman); “A Day at the zoo” (dir. Matthew Gidney); “Playin’ hard to get” (dir. Tim Bullock); “Boambee return” (dir. Liz Crosby); “Burn” (dir. Michael Dunning); “The Cutting room floor” (dir. Steve Baker); “Ride on” (dir. Nick Wyles).

results.title: Trooping the colour: a famous British ceremony
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An authentic description of one of Britain’s most colourful ceremonies. Includes footage of Queen Elizabeth II, Duke of Edinburgh and Duke of Gloucester.

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1964
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine recording the Trooping the Colour ceremony in 1964. Contains footage of Queen Elizabeth II leaving Buckingham Palace on horse to attend the ceremony and appearing on the balcony with 3 month-old Prince Edward and other members of the Royal family at the end of the ceremony. Provides a detailed description and explanation of this famous ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1949
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour by the Brigade of Horse Guards on the occasion of the King’s birthday, 9th June, 1949. His Majesty, King George VI, and the Duke of Gloucester take part in the ceremony and the then Princess Elizabeth takes the salute at this impressive ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, [1947]
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour on the occasion of King George VI’s birthday on 9th June, 1947(?) with the then Princess Elizabeth taking the salute. Also includes segments on the Royal Braemar Gathering, attended by King George VI, Princess Elizabeth and Princess Margaret, and Changing of the Guard. This is a silent film with captions.
